sentence:
b' 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Open Science in Developmental Science 

Lisa A. Gennetian 

Duke University 

Michael Frank 

Stanford University 

 

 

Catherine S. Tamis-LeMonda 

New York University 

Acknowledgements 

We thank Ryder Buttry and Taylor Cole for their assistance in compiling some of the background 

information and data for this paper.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: CTL acknowledges funding from the National Institutes of \n\nChild Health and Development (Grant number: R01HD094830).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
1 

\x0cAbstract 

Open science policies have proliferated in the social and behavioral sciences in recent 

years, including sharing study designs, protocols, and data, and pre-registering hypotheses.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Developmental research has moved more slowly than some other disciplines in adopting open 

science practices, in part because developmental science is often descriptive, and does not always 

strictly adhere to a confirmatory approach.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
We assess the state of open science practices in 

developmental science and offer a broader definition of open science that includes replication, 

reproducibility, data reuse, and global reach.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
2 

\x0c\xe2\x80\x9cProgress in science is marked by reducing uncertainty about nature.\xe2\x80\x9d (Nosek et al., 2018) 

Developmental science seeks to understand how children learn and change across the 

environments of everyday life.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Towards this goal, the field aims to accumulate increasingly 

precise observations and integrate them into theories that expand the breadth, depth, and 

predictive accuracy of knowledge (Munaf\xc3\xb2 et al., 2017).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
However, findings in developmental 

psychology \xe2\x80\x93 as many other fields \xe2\x80\x93 do not always conform to a model of cumulative science 

(Ioannidis, 2005; Moody et al., 2022).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Many findings may not be replicable in new samples, meaning that new data yield results 

inconsistent with the original (Nosek et al., 2022; Open Science Collaboration, 2015).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Perhaps 

even more troublingly, some scientific findings may not be computationally reproducible, 

meaning that their numerical conclusions cannot be duplicated by a new researcher starting from 

the same dataset (Hardwicke, 2019; Hardwicke et al., 2021; Stodden et al., 2018).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Data reuse \xe2\x80\x93 in 

which researchers share their data to foster new questions and analyses \xe2\x80\x93 is also rare, leading to 

reduced impact of scientific investments.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Finally, the lens of developmental science tends to be 

narrow in global reach, with most studies conducted by scientists in North America and Europe 

on children from a handful of countries (Kidd & Garcia, 2021; Nielsen et al., 2017).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: These four \n\nRs \xe2\x80\x93 broad goals for an open science movement \xe2\x80\x93 are summarized in Table 1.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Research practices that interfere with these four goals are exacerbated in child 

development research (Davis-Kean & Ellis, 2019; Frank et al., 2017).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Developmental studies 

often have low statistical power due to small samples of convenience that arise from the costs and 

challenges of recruiting and studying minors.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Children are not always compliant participants, and 

coupled with typical challenges related to time, scheduling, and life circumstances that interrupt 

 

 

 

3 

\x0cadults and caregivers, high attrition rates magnify the complexities of securing valid and unbiased 

data.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Furthermore, because direct instruction is not possible with young participants (e.g., 

infants), measurements may be inconsistent, and researchers are left to infer the meaning of 

highly variable responses (e.g., looking time, object manipulation, heart rate, or head-turns).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
And, 

because much of developmental science relies on video-recorded observations, sharing of raw 

data requires careful ethical consideration because faces and names are identifiable.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Finally, 

disproportionate resources and access to research by investigators from different regions of the 

world limits the reach of developmental science.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Open science practices are designed to address these challenges, but scientific disciplines 

differ in the extent to which they value and adopt such practices.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Moreover, within-discipline 

differences may exist depending on research design (e.g., pre-registration is more widely used and 

accepted in randomized control trials).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Thus, given the wide range of what falls under the 

umbrella of developmental science, variation among researchers in open science practices is no 

surprise.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: The adoption of open science is not all or none, however.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Instead, each additional 

practice moves the field incrementally towards the broader goals of reproducibility, replicability, 

reuse, and global reach (Klein et al., 2018).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Open science practices are, if anything, even more critically central to developmental 

science than to other subfields.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: Children as research participants are a vulnerable population of \n\ngreat societal importance and investment.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
And although public and private stakeholders uniformly 

agree on the need to protect children\xe2\x80\x99s well-being, there is no consensus on how best to do so, 

even within the scientific community.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: Thus, cultivating public trust in the scientific enterprise is \n\nparamount.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Furthermore, the substantial financial and time investments required to study 

children\xe2\x80\x99s learning and development (including costs of equipment and time burden to parents 

 

 

4 

\x0cand children) mean that researchers have an ethical obligation to maximize the value of public 

investment and to accelerate scientific discoveries through open science practices.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
In this review we present key goals for the broad application of open science practices in 

developmental science; address the challenges in doing so; and survey the current state of the 

field.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Our review complements existing publications (Asarnow et al., 2018; Branney et al., 2019; 

Gehlbach & Robinson, 2021; Klein et al., 2018; Nosek et al., 2022; Tackett et al., 2019) and adds 

to the wealth of available resources on open science practices by addressing issues specific to 

developmental science.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Notably, we move beyond narrow and rigid interpretations of open 

science that have likely impeded its wider acceptance and adoption: Open science is not, and 

should not be, narrowly defined by any specific policy, whether it be data sharing, preregistration, 

or badges rewarding such practices (Kidwell et al., 2016).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
A broad and flexible view of open 

science must include practices that increase transparency at all stages of the scientific enterprise 

(Soska et al., 2021).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
The Goals of Open Science: The 4 R\xe2\x80\x99s 

The open science movement pursues scientific transparency policies to enhance 

replicability, improve reproducibility, accelerate discovery through reuse, and broaden global 

reach.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: In this section, we briefly review policies and practices in the service of each of these \n\ngoals.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: Box 1 provides select examples of precedent-setting initiatives in developmental science \n\nthat work towards these goals.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Enhancing the Replicability of Results in New Samples 

One major catalyst for the open science movement has been the failure of independent 

researchers to replicate the findings of many published studies (Moody et al., 2022; Nosek et al., 

2022; Open Science Collaboration, 2015).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Much ink has been spilled around what precisely 

 

 

5 

\x0cconstitutes replication and when such a study should be considered successful (Nosek & 

Errington, 2020; Zwaan et al., 2018).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: In developmental science, not every finding should be \n\nreplicable across samples and contexts.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Yet failure of replication due to statistical issues in the 

original study is preventable: If a reported result is due to random sampling variation rather than 

true signal in the data, it is by definition un-replicable \xe2\x80\x93 leading to wasted efforts by teams that 

follow up on it.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
The practice of \xe2\x80\x9cp-hacking\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x93 taking advantage of undisclosed analytic flexibility 

to report statistically significant findings \xe2\x80\x93 may be a major source of replication failures (Nosek et 

al., 2022; Open Science Collaboration, 2015).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Preregistration \xe2\x80\x93 traditionally defined as specifying outcomes and analyses in an open and 

independent repository before collecting data \xe2\x80\x93 is one response to the challenge of p-hacking.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
By 

reporting all conditions and measures in a study and planning hypothesis tests, experimenters can 

remove extra \xe2\x80\x9cdegrees of freedom\xe2\x80\x9d that may lead to spurious discoveries (Nosek et al., 2018; 

Simmons et al., 2011).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Preregistration is mandated in clinical trials (e.g., via clinicaltrials.gov) to 

avoid incorrect conclusions that could incur harm to patients; empirically, this policy has reduced 

publication and reporting bias (Kaplan & Irvin, 2015).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Registered reports, in which manuscripts 

undergo peer review prior to data collection, are one especially promising form of preregistration 

for some study types (Nosek & Lakens, 2014).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Not all research in developmental science adheres to a hypothesis testing approach, 

however.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Much research is descriptive or exploratory, with researchers annotating events based 

on video or audio recordings or language transcriptions, and sometimes live observations, in the 

absence of any expectations about what they will find.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Such work provides critical insights into 

developmental processes and can spur new hypotheses that are grounded in careful 

documentation of behavior.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Although descriptive and exploratory research (rather than 

 

 

6 

\x0cconfirmatory experiments) may not fit with current norms of pre-registration, many aspects of 

research plans can be registered before embarking on an exploratory or descriptive study.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
For 

example, researchers can pre-register (1) the source of data, study design, methods, and 

stimuli/materials; (2) behaviors they plan to code from video-recorded observations or language 

transcripts; (3) plans for calculating reliability, (4) approaches to data quality assurance; and (5) 

tentative plans for analysis, perhaps accompanied by a note that additional analyses will be 

conducted based on what researchers find (Kosie & Lew-Williams, 2022).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Researchers who are 

unsure about certain components of their research plans can engage in sequential pre-registration 

(Nosek et al., 2018).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: Such steps increase transparency about pre-planned aspects of a study while \n\nmaintaining the flexibility necessary for description and discovery in rich datasets.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Increasing Analytic Reproducibility 

Developmental research is rich in methodological and analytic breadth that continues to 

expand.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
For example, developmental research uses neuroscience, physiology, and computational 

models; the great reliance on analytic code in such work amplifies concerns about computational 

reproducibility.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Because developmental psychology as a field has a newer culture around 

computational methods, cultural transfer of good coding practices such as the use of version 

control and code review may be less common than in other subfields (Poldrack et al., 2017).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Thus, open science practices that seek to decrease errors and increase reproducibility are critical 

for developmental research.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: \n\nUnfortunately, errors in data analysis and reporting are common.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
An analysis of research 

texts found that approximately half of published psychology articles contain at least one statistical 

reporting error (defined as a set of reported statistical values that are internally inconsistent with 

one another), an estimate that is likely conservative (Nuijten et al., 2016).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Furthermore, when 

 

 

7 

\x0cteams of analysts download data from papers (which presupposes that the data are available), only 

around a third of findings can be fully reproduced without assistance from the authors (Chang & 

Li, 2017; Hardwicke et al., 2021).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: These findings suggest that when errors exist, they typically \n\ncannot be detected and corrected.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Transparency \xe2\x80\x93 sharing both analytic code and the data on which it operates \xe2\x80\x93 is both a 

motivator for better organization and documentation by the original authors and a step that allows 

others to identify errors or verify results (Klein et al., 2018).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
The creation and availability of 

computational technical tools that assist with reproducing analyses have facilitated the sharing of 

code and data together (Aust & Barth, 2018; Kluyver et al., 2016).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
In some cases, requiring 

authors to make data available as a condition of publication acceptance or the receipt of study 

funding has also helped researchers incorporate time and resources costs as part of the production 

of research output.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
The availability of code and data not only facilitates the exact reproduction of a finding, it 

also allows analysts to check the robustness of the finding.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Robustness in this case is a term used 

to describe how sensitive a finding is to specific analytic decisions (including, for example, 

coding of the dependent variable, inclusion or exclusion of certain independent variables or 

covariates, and related modeling decisions).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
A finding can be analytically reproducible but 

nevertheless of limited utility if it only emerges when certain control variables are entered into a 

regression model (Duncan, 2014).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Increasingly, when their findings depend on a complex analytic 

model, researchers are encouraged to include robustness checks and perhaps even report a 

\xe2\x80\x9dmultiverse\xe2\x80\x9d analysis in which they conduct a large set of different analyses to examine 

sensitivity to certain modeling or analytic decisions more formally (Steegen et al., 2016).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
8 

\x0cAccelerating Discovery Through Reuse 

A third goal of open science is to maximize the value of research and enable new 

discoveries by leveraging prior research investments.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
A lack of transparency and sharing of 

research methods and raw data creates considerable inefficiencies in the scientific enterprise by 

benefitting individual investigators while decreasing value for the broader scientific community.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
The rich data and methods employed by developmental scientists may make reuse opportunities 

even more important in developmental science than in other fields (Gilmore & Qian, 2022).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
As 

one example, video recordings of children and/or their interactions with caregivers are a 

cornerstone of many developmental studies that capture behaviors in the whole child and 

surrounding context.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: Their wide availability can foster video-based behavioral coding and \n\nscientific insights beyond the original motivations or primary research questions (Adolph, 2020).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Similarly, readily available and publicly accessible data from resources such as the National 

Longitudinal Survey of Youth, the child supplement of the Panel Study of Income Dynamics, the 

NICHD Study of Child Care and Youth Development and the National Longitudinal Study of 

Adolescent Health have also been fundamental to accelerating discovery about the roles of 

children\xe2\x80\x99s broader family and social environments in development.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Open science practices also allow researchers to aggregate data across children and 

developmental contexts by combining available datasets to better understand mechanisms of 

developmental change (Frank et al., 2021).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Among its many possible contributions, aggregation 

allows researchers to build a sufficient sample to investigate developmental processes that affect 

narrow populations (e.g., children with impaired vision or hearing).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Policies that require 

researchers to share materials, data, and code in findable, accessible, interoperable, and reusable 

(FAIR) repositories have been much more successful and effective thansharing \xe2\x80\x9con demand\xe2\x80\x9d or 

 

 

9 

\x0c\xe2\x80\x9con request\xe2\x80\x9d (Wicherts et al., 2006).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: Such sharing maximizes the scientific value of a dataset, a \n\ngoal that is relevant for both research participants and funders (Brakewood & Poldrack, 2013).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Finally, repeating and building on a study may require recreating materials developed by 

another investigator.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: Because developmental research can be sensitive to the nuances of particular \n\nstimuli, dissemination of materials can play an outsized role in guiding new experiments.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Although proprietary attitudes about stimuli are common \xe2\x80\x93 perhaps because of a desire for 

exclusive access to stimuli that were costly to create or to avoid questions about original results 

(e.g., Phillips et al., 2015) \xe2\x80\x93 sharing of stimulus materials can be done in ways that credit creators 

and substantially increase the impact of published work.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
For example, all materials shared on sites 

like Databrary and OSF contain a Digital Object Identifier (DOI) that should be cited to credit the 

researcher who has shared resources (Simon et al., 2015).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Expanding Reach and Building Global Capacity 

A final objective of open science practices is to expand the reach and inclusivity of 

developmental studies to represent researchers and children from regions across the globe.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Variety in contexts, perspectives, and backgrounds is critical to building a global representative 

developmental science.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
However, most developmental samples are typically drawn from a narrow 

range of cultures, populations, and languages, which stymies  efforts to draw generalizable 

conclusions about the nature of developmental variation and change (Kidd & Garcia, 2021; 

Nielsen et al., 2017).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Nurturing scientific studies from a broad range of scholars and contexts can 

ensure the inclusion of different populations of children through their knowledge of and 

sensitivity toward their cultural community.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Perhaps even more importantly, researchers from 

different cultural communities contribute new perspectives and questions that may be important 

in their context but overlooked in others.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Practices that expand the reach of developmental science 

 

 

10 

\x0cinclude open access to scholarly products, open sharing of research materials (from protocols to 

raw data of all kinds), and democratization of research evaluation.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Open access to scholarly products means that researchers around the globe can access 

scientific research in a timely fashion.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: Much literature is published behind \xe2\x80\x9cpaywalls\xe2\x80\x9d, requiring \n\nan expensive institutional subscription for individuals to browse the literature freely.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Individuals 

without institutional affiliations or those from less-resourced institutions often cannot access the 

most recent literature, a clear obstacle to their scientific contributions.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Open sharing of research products (e.g., protocols, stimuli, behavioral coding manuals, 

analytic code, video recordings, and raw and processed flat-tile data) reduces the cost of research 

for individuals in lower-resource contexts.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Open sharing allows researchers to leverage existing 

materials and data in repositories for study replication, analytic reproducibility, and data reuse 

(e.g., coding new behaviors from video recordings of infants or by applying new analyses to 

longitudinal datasets).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: Furthermore, large collaborative projects and repositories can bring \n\nprominence to the contributions of researchers from across the globe.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Finally, open science practices that focus on transparency can shift emphasis away from 

the evaluation of research products based on institutional and individual reputation towards 

evaluation of the contribution of research products.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
For example, by providing third-party 

endorsement of quality standards met by the study, clearinghouses and \xe2\x80\x9cwhat works\xe2\x80\x9d registries 

(Hill & Buckley, 2021; Home Visiting Evidence of Effectiveness Review, n.d.) ease demands on 

users of research and incentivize transparency.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
The State of Open Science in Developmental Science 

Given the benefits of open science practices and many recent papers on the topic, where 

does the field of developmental science currently stand?
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
In 2016, the Society for Research in 

 

 

11 

\x0cChild Development (SRCD, home to flagship journals of Child Development and Child 

Development Perspectives) convened a committee on Open Science Practices, charged with 

assessing the state of the field and issuing a consensus statement on behalf of the society.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Three 

years later, the society ratified a policy suggesting that authors \xe2\x80\x9cnote if and where\xe2\x80\x9d their materials 

are shared, and that society publications consider the future and role of pre-registered and 

replication studies in their flagship journals.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
The society\xe2\x80\x99s reluctance to mandate open-science 

practices reflected their sensitivity to variation in attitudes among society members and concerns 

that open science practices can impede rather than generate and accelerate scientific progress 

(Gennetian et al., 2020; Gilmore et al., 2020).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: How has adoption of these practices progressed \n\nsince?
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: In this section, we review uptake of open science policies in developmental science.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Progress toward replicability  

Funders, journals, and professional societies have increasingly encouraged researchers to 

embrace practices around transparency and open sharing of all forms \xe2\x80\x93 including study methods 

and materials, the use of video for demonstrating study procedures, and the pre-registration of 

study questions and hypotheses.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: Such practices promise to increase the replicability of research.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: \n\nChanging expectations, attitudes, and behaviors around pre-registration offers one example.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Researchers engaged in NIH funded clinical and behavioral interventions must now pre-register 

their research questions, hypotheses, analysis plans, etc.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: in clinicaltrials.org.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: Other research \n\nfunders (e.g., the Arnold Foundation) have followed this lead.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: Still, much basic developmental \n\nresearch \xe2\x80\x93 which largely does not entail randomized trials \xe2\x80\x93 is not subject to such mandates.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Nevertheless, researchers interested in preregistration can use independent registry sites such as 

AsPredicted.org or the Open Science Framework (OSF).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
OSF represents one of the largest pre-registration portals available for developmental 

 

 

12 

\x0cresearchers: It is host to over 10,000 projects identified under search terms \xe2\x80\x9cchild development,\xe2\x80\x9d 

\xe2\x80\x9ccognitive development,\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x9cbrain development,\xe2\x80\x9d and \xe2\x80\x9csocio-emotional health.\xe2\x80\x9d Figure 1 shows for 

example that the number of registered studies through OSF when searching terms based on child 

development epochs \xe2\x80\x9cinfant\xe2\x80\x9d or \xe2\x80\x9cadolescent\xe2\x80\x9d has increased seven-fold from 2012 to 2021.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Although most preregistration templates focus on hypothesis testing for randomized experiments, 

guidelines on pre-registration of secondary data analyses (Akker et al., 2021), longitudinal 

research (Petersen et al., 2022), and descriptive, discovery science (Kosie & Lew-Williams, 2022) 

are emerging.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: Norms are slowly shifting with increases to preregistration of articles published in \n\nmany flagship journals of developmental science.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: We offer a glance at this progress within a set \n\nof 20 peer-reviewed journals in Table 1.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Reproducibility and reuse: Data sharing policies 

Data sharing is increasing in psychology.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
More than half of psychology researchers 

reported sharing their data, although the quality and reusability of shared datasets is often low 

(Borghi & Gulick, 2021; Hardwicke, 2019; Towse et al., 2021).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Moreover, what constitutes 

sharing and what is shared (e.g., raw data vs. processed data; tabular data vs. video recordings) 

differs enormously across researchers.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
As the primary mechanism for production of scientific scholarship, peer reviewed journals 

play a substantive role in shaping policies around data sharing and transparency.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Yet journals 

have been reluctant to mandate data sharing or to enforce data-sharing policies (Wicherts et al., 

2006).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
The Transparency and Openness Promotion (TOP) guidelines attempted to create uniform 

standards around data sharing practices (Nosek et al., 2015), but their adoption has been 

piecemeal (see Table 1).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: In contrast, funder mandates for data sharing have moved more quickly.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Since 2011, the US National Science Foundation has required its grantees to submit a data 

 

 

13 

\x0cmanagement plan, and the US National Institutes of Health mandated open data sharing for its 

grantees starting in 2023.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Other major funders of developmental science have similarly adopted 

data sharing mandates, including the Wellcome Trust (2016) and the Robert Wood Johnson 

Foundation (2019).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
The next frontier for such policies will be to ensure that data are shared in a 

way that maximizes their value so that they are discoverable and can be combined with other data 

to accelerate scientific discovery.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Expanding global reach 

Growing awareness of the need for diversity, equity, and inclusion in psychological 

studies has spurred efforts to broaden the representation of underrepresented groups around the 

world among both the scientists conducting research and the children participating in research.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Such efforts include open access to publications; global access and contributions to the scientific 

database on children\xe2\x80\x99s development; transparency and thoroughness in reporting sample 

demographics in published works; and mechanisms for scientists to broadly collaborate on study 

design, implementation, and sharing of research products.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: \n\nOpen access to research products.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Despite widespread endorsement of open access to 

published studies \xe2\x80\x93 with many researchers viewing open access as an ethical imperative \xe2\x80\x93 the 

adoption of such practices has been inconsistent and rife with challenges.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: Progress towards open \n\naccess in psychology has been considerable, though far from perfect.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: By one estimate, more than \n\n50% of published psychology articles are available through some form of open access.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: Within \n\ndevelopmental science, \xe2\x80\x9cgold\xe2\x80\x9d (paid) open access is an option for many journals (Table 1).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
For 

open access advocates, the key challenge has been engaging funders and stakeholders to avoid 

exacerbating disparities by burdening authors with extra publication fees (Brainard, 2021) in what 

risks becoming a \xe2\x80\x9cpay to publish\xe2\x80\x9d system.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
14 

\x0cYet the biggest change in the open access landscape has been the rise of \xe2\x80\x9cgreen\xe2\x80\x9d open 

access.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: Fueled in part by the need to disseminate research rapidly during the covid-19 pandemic \n\n(Watson, 2022), preprint servers like arXiv, bioArXiv, and psyArXiv have grown tremendously.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
At the time of writing, psyArXiv hosts more than 22,000 psychology papers and is growing by 

around 20 papers per day, with authors typically posting papers before submitting for publication 

at a peer-reviewed journal.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: \n\nPreprints serve several purposes.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: First, they guarantee access to published work in un-\n\ntypeset form even if the eventual published article is inaccessible.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Second, and perhaps more 

important to their adoption, they allow authors to share their work when it is completed, 

addressing the career hurdles that may arise when papers are under review for months or even 

years.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
By listing preprints on a CV or in a grant application, early career researchers can gain 

credit for what they have accomplished to date, rather than only at the end of a long and uncertain 

publication process.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Finally, by making research results available regardless of publication 

outcomes, preprints can help counter biases in the literature caused by the reluctance of some 

journals to publish null findings, failed replications, or applications of unconventional theories or 

methods (Wingen et al., 2022).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: \n\nTransparency about samples.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
In 2020, the Society for Research on Child Development 

enacted policies on the reporting of sample characteristics, a direction spearheaded by former 

Editor in Chief Cynthia Garcia Coll.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Specifically, SRCD\xe2\x80\x99s policy requires authors to clearly 

specify recruitment procedures and sampling decisions; participant characteristics including 

race/ethnicity, socioeconomic status, native language; and contextual information to frame the 

study, including the country, region, city, and so on where data were collected.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Full transparency 

on the characteristics and contexts of developmental studies serves the dual goals of increasing 

 

 

15 

\x0cdiversity in the participants of research and advancing efforts towards the replicability of findings.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: \n\nAccess to and contributing data to the knowledge base.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
The broad and open sharing of 

research methods, behavioral coding manuals, analytic code, and raw and processed data of all 

forms \xe2\x80\x93 in repositories such as OSF and Databrary \xe2\x80\x93 supports diversity, equity, and inclusion by 

allowing researchers from around the world to both access and contribute to the knowledge base 

on child development.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Researchers only require an internet connection to download 

developmental data of all forms to ask new questions on existing data or to leverage research 

stimuli, methods, etc.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: to replicate and extend existing studies to new samples.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Moreover, the 

ability of researchers to contribute data openly provides a valuable mechanism for expanding the 

knowledge base on child development \xe2\x80\x93 from the overly narrow samples of children represented 

in research today to samples drawn from around the world in future studies.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: \n\nCreating spaces for collaboration.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Cross-lab collaboration among researchers from 

different countries or regions of a country (e.g., rural and urban) allows investigators from 

different backgrounds, languages, and cultures to share their expertise, samples, and resources to 

address topics of mutual interest (Frank et al., 2017).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Such collaborations in turn help ensure that 

developmental theories and findings are grounded in the experiences of children from a variety of 

backgrounds.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Collaborative science also allows researchers to pool resources across sites to 

recruit a larger sample than would be possible by a single lab, an approach that is particularly 

important when recruiting children from special populations where generating a sample of 

sufficient size is a challenge (e.g., children with disabilities).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Exciting new initiatives around 

consortia and data repositories, described next, provide platforms to facilitate collaboration and 

extend the reach of developmental science.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
16 

 

\x0cConsortia and Repositories: New Drivers of Open Science 

As reviewed, the adoption of open science practices in developmental science has been 

uneven.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: At the same time, the field is steadily expanding.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: One of the most exciting trends in the \n\nopen science landscape is the rise of open, collaborative mega-projects.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
These are sometimes 

described under the umbrella of \xe2\x80\x9cbig team science\xe2\x80\x9d (Coles et al., 2022), in which difficult 

research challenges \xe2\x80\x93 data collection, behavioral coding, transcriptions, materials creation, and 

analyses \xe2\x80\x93 are distributed across a community, creating a larger and more impactful product by 

virtue of the collaboration.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: In developmental science, collaborative projects and big team science \n\nhave typically taken the form of either data collection consortia or collaborative data repositories.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Here we highlight a few select examples to illustrate how such mechanisms can drive progress 

towards open science goals.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Consortium research 

Several developmental science consortia have adopted collaborative research initiatives 

that are grounded in an open-science framework.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: For example, ManyBabies (MB) is a research \n\nconsortium for pursuing multi-lab collaborative projects.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: The first ManyBabies project was a \n\nreplication of the well-known phenomenon of an infant-directed speech preference.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
The goal was 

to measure variability in findings across infant populations and experimental methods 

(ManyBabies Consortium, 2020); with 67 labs contributing data, this project represents one of the 

largest experimental investigations of infancy to date.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Initially devised as a way of pursuing best-

practices replications of important phenomena (Frank et al., 2017), the consortium has 

increasingly taken on new projects that require coordinated effort to solve a difficult theoretical or 

empirical challenge.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Critically, open science practices are woven throughout ManyBabies 

projects: All projects are preregistered (typically as Registered Reports); all materials, analytic 

 

 

17 

\x0ccode, and data are released as part of the project; and participation is open to the entire research 

community.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
By actively pursuing global collaborations and by lowering the barriers to 

participation, ManyBabies aims to broaden the set of labs and investigators contributing to cutting 

edge experimental work in developmental science, with a special focus on training graduate 

students and providing mentorship on open science practices.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
The NIH-funded Play and Learning throughout A Year (PLAY) project describes a 

complementary but distinct model for pursuing open science goals within consortium research 

(play-project.org).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Through a model of synergistic, collaborative science among 72 

developmental researchers, PLAY will gather 1000+ hours of video of 12\xe2\x80\x9324 month-old children 

and their mothers engaged in everyday activities in the home environment across 30 

geographically distributed sites in the United States; transcribe language interactions between 

infants and mothers; and collaboratively annotate videos for behaviors of locomotion, emotion, 

object play, and language pragmatics (across 48 behavioral coding labs) following consensus 

standards created by subgroups of participating domain experts.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
The goal of PLAY is to create an 

openly available video corpus with annotations and associated metadata for authorized 

investigators on Databrary who can address new questions about learning and development 

during the second postnatal year.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
As with ManyBabies, PLAY openly shares consensus best-

practice methods and guides that can be applied beyond the original study, including behavioral 

coding manuals, transcription guidelines, and newly created survey instruments for Spanish-

English dual-language learners.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Most centrally, PLAY uses video to demonstrate all aspects of the 

study protocol (e.g., recruitment of families; interviews with mothers about children\xe2\x80\x99s vocabulary, 

temperament, locomotor skills; how to conduct video tours of participants\xe2\x80\x99 homes, and so on).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
These two projects \xe2\x80\x93 and others in psychology broadly (e.g., the Psychological Science 

 

 

18 

\x0cAccelerator; Moshontz et al., 2018) \xe2\x80\x93 share a commitment to open science practices with goals to 

broadly disseminate science practices and build capacity for researchers who likewise seek to 

engage in open science.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
For example, participants in the first ManyBabies study noted in an 

informal survey that they were much more likely to adopt open science practices in their own labs 

having tried them in a supportive context (Byers-Heinlein et al., 2020).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
In addition, use of the 

open standards, tools, and materials created by these projects provide illustrative models on the 

value of transparency for the next generation of student trainees and non-participating labs.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Open data repositories 

Data repositories and platforms both promote open science and allow for generative 

research beyond the boundaries of original data collection goals or investigators.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Large data 

repositories such as the Inter-University Consortium for Political and Social Research (ICPSR) 

provide a database of longitudinal and national studies with information about children\xe2\x80\x99s 

developmental environments and outcomes (e.g., the National Survey of Children\xe2\x80\x99s Health).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Indeed, some of these repositories have arrangements with professional organizations to also 

serve as co-hosts for data deposits of published research articles (e.g.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: OpenICPSR collaborates \n\nwith, for example, the American Education Research and American Economic Associations).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Below, we describe three successful examples specific to developmental research that have 

overcome the perceived barriers of broad data availability related to working with vulnerable 

populations and collecting sensitive data.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
TalkBank is an open-access repository of naturally occurring spoken language 

(MacWhinney, 2019).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: The TalkBank corpora currently contains 122 million words across 44 \n\nlanguages, and it has generated over 8000 publications across thousands of users.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Developmental 

researchers have leveraged the openly shared transcripts of TalkBank to tackle questions about 

 

 

19 

\x0clanguage learning and speech production in monolingual and bilingual populations from diverse 

cultural communities, individuals experiencing language disfluencies (e.g., stuttering), persons 

with autism spectrum disorder, and so on, and it even contains transcripts from classroom 

settings.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
TalkBank\xe2\x80\x99s reliance on an openly shared uniform transcription format (CHAT), 

facilitates combining language data across studies, and thus allows researchers to analyze various 

components of language \xe2\x80\x93 phonology, lexicon, syntax, and discourse \xe2\x80\x93 across larger samples than 

would be possible in a single lab.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Databrary (databrary.org) is a restricted access video data library specialized for sharing, 

storing, and streaming video-based data in the form of inherently identifiable video and audio 

recordings of children with and without caregivers or demonstrating research methods.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
The 

database allows researchers to ask new questions by accessing video recordings of children of 

different ages, in different settings, engaged in a rich variety of activities (e.g., bookreading with 

caregivers, natural play in the home environment).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Currently, Databrary has over 1,500 

investigators at 700+ institutions across 5 continents, and contains over 90,000+ hours of video 

recordings.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Databrary consent forms offer participants options for different release levels for data 

stored in the database, including sharing with authorized researchers, learning audiences (e.g., 

talks and classes), or the broader public.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Wordbank is an open database of children\xe2\x80\x99s vocabulary development, archiving data from 

a specific parent report instrument for measuring children\xe2\x80\x99s early language, the MacArthur-Bates 

Communicative Development Inventory (Frank et al., 2016).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
The repository contains data from 

more than 78,000 children and 39 languages, allowing for a rich characterization of how language 

learning varies across cultures and contexts (Frank et al., 2021).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Unlike broader repositories such 

as OSF and Databrary, Wordbank takes advantage of the uniform format of its data to allow for 

 

 

20 

\x0caccess and browsing of the data through both interactive online visualizations and a programmatic 

interface.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Challenges for Open Science in Developmental Science 

Although developmental science has made substantial progress in embracing open science 

during the past ten years, many obstacles remain.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
In this section, we discuss three perceived 

challenges for open science in developmental science: tensions between exploration and 

confirmation, the potential for career risks, and how open science practices intersect with the goal 

of fostering an inclusive science.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Each of these critiques is important to understand in its own 

right, and also because critiques of specific, narrowly construed policies can unproductively 

undermine perceptions of the value of open science more broadly.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: \n\nDoes open science limit exploration and discovery?
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Initial open science reforms focused on correcting perceived issues in experimental 

psychology, for example by reducing the risk of p-hacking.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Thus, many policies initially assumed 

that preregistration simply entailed registering a hypothesis about condition differences and 

depositing a single tabular data file in a repository.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Although this narrow conceptualization may 

be a useful starting point, it does not conform to many developmentalist scientists\xe2\x80\x99 vision of their 

work, which can involve observational designs, rich behavioral and/or physiological measures, 

longitudinal observations, and deep appreciation of the limitations of generalizing across samples 

with different characteristics.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Recent reforms have been increasingly sensitive to the broader set of research goals and 

activities that define developmental science.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
For example, preregistrations may productively take 

many forms that promote transparency about the research process without a strict focus on 

hypothesis testing, as reflected in the breadth of preregistration templates available on the Open 

 

 

21 

\x0cScience Framework.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Furthermore, initiatives like ManyBabies recognize that the combination of 

rich data and privacy concerns may lead to the need for more careful data sharing policies (e.g., 

sharing tabular data via an open channel like OSF and sharing raw video data through a more 

restricted access channel such as Databrary).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: \n\nDoes open science pose risks to career enhancement and development?
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
In a casual interaction between one of the authors of this paper and an early career scholar 

in psychology, a query about pre-registering new exploratory work was met with dismay by the 

early career scholar who declared, \xe2\x80\x9cif I pre-register this pilot work, I\xe2\x80\x99ll get yelled at by everyone 

for what I did not get right.\xe2\x80\x9d Transparency in research is not always comfortable!
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: Sharing data \n\nand analysis code can lead researchers to worry that mistakes in their work will be identified.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Yet 

this worry may be misplaced: Researchers tend to be judged by whether they are open to 

correcting issues or errors in their work, not whether they are correct to begin with (Ebersole et 

al., 2016).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Sharing resources prior to publication can also lead researchers to worry that their work 

will be \xe2\x80\x9cscooped\xe2\x80\x9d or their ideas will be co-opted.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: Both might have more severe consequences for \n\nearly career researchers.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Collision of ideas is a part of science, especially in fast-moving fields 

(Kim & Corn, 2018), but \xe2\x80\x93 when used appropriately \xe2\x80\x93 open science practices can be part of the 

solution, not part of the problem.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: For example, posting preprints is an important way to establish \n\nprecedence independent of the vagaries of peer review (Kriegeskorte, 2016).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
And while scooping 

is a real issue, its risks can be mitigated by strategic decision-making about which data to release 

and when (Popkin, 2019).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
For example, a researcher might decide to make a public release of 

only enough data from a larger dataset to ensure reproducibility of the key results in a paper, 

embargoing the full raw dataset for a set period (e.g., two years) to allow for completion of a 

 

 

22 

\x0cpublication(s).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: This step would signal to observers that the researcher values openness and \n\nsharing, while also protecting the researcher\xe2\x80\x99s future interest.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Although it can be challenging for researchers to navigate the changing landscape of open 

science practices, many of these practices can have positive career value \xe2\x80\x93 by allowing greater 

transparency in understanding a researcher\xe2\x80\x99s contributions and by signaling a commitment to 

shared scientific values.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Senior researchers should encourage doctoral and postdoctoral 

researchers in their labs \xe2\x80\x93 the next generation of developmental scientists \xe2\x80\x93 to list open-science 

practices on their resumes (e.g., publications for which they share video, stimuli, methods, 

behavioral coding manuals, data, analytic code, etc.)
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: so they can be properly credited for their \n\ncommitment to scientific transparency and integrity.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: \n\nDoes open science raise barriers for inclusion and diversity in who conducts science?
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Many open science policies are compatible with \xe2\x80\x93 and in some cases, designed to 

\xe2\x80\x93 decrease historical barriers to involvement in science.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Open access policies, especially preprint 

posting, democratize access to the scientific literature, removing the barrier of access to 

institutional journal subscriptions.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Data, code, and materials sharing policies allow researchers 

without personal access to a scientific network to access experimental materials and analytic 

techniques to the same extent as those who occupy positions of privilege in the social network of 

science.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: Such changes are necessary to decrease inequities in science \xe2\x80\x93 but they are not in \n\nthemselves sufficient.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
To diversify the research community in developmental science beyond 

majority groups in a small number of nations, developmental scientists must engage in active 

outreach, seeking to build networks that broaden participation and construct training pipelines and 

collaborative ventures that lead scholars from a wide range of backgrounds into the field.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Such 

collaborations must be reciprocal in nature to ensure they are grounded in community input (i.e., 

 

 

23 

\x0cparticipatory research) at all stages of the research process \xe2\x80\x93 from questions, to design and 

methods, to implementation of the study, to analyses and dissemination of findings.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
When scientists engage with complex social issues, the chance of skepticism and criticism 

is high.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Motivated individuals may seek to undermine findings that do not align with their 

personal beliefs, subjecting evidence to increased scrutiny based on desired outcomes rather than 

the quality of research.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: In the face of such scrutiny, researchers may be tempted to withhold \n\ndetails and to shy away from transparency.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: But researchers should do precisely the opposite.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
When work is conducted with full transparency, critics and advocates can assess the strength of 

the evidence and researchers can easily refute charges of selective or biased reporting.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Furthermore, because controversial areas of research are precisely where public trust in science is 

likely to be lowest, researchers should be as scrupulous as possible in following policies that are 

designed to maximize credibility.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Suggestions for the Future 

The 4Rs \xe2\x80\x93 replication, reproducibility, reuse, and reach \xe2\x80\x93 offer an organizing action-

oriented framework for ongoing adoption and adaptation of open science practices in 

developmental science.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: As described, funder, journal, and institutional policies are key \n\ninstruments for encouraging the adoption of open science practices.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: Yet, implemented in \n\nisolation, many policies meet with resistance and avoidance.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Policy alone is not enough to 

produce concrete changes to behavior without educating stakeholders about why policies exist 

and how to follow them, fostering changes in social norms, creating incentives for compliance, 

and building capacity.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: We discuss each of these directions in turn.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Educating stakeholders 

Policy interventions are most effective when the people they affect understand them 

 

 

24 

\x0c(Weisman & Markman, 2017), especially when compliance with a policy requires learning new 

tools or thinking through new issues.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: Thus, for open science policies to be maximally effective, \n\nresearchers need to be educated about how and why to carry them out.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
First, the whys and hows 

of open-science practices should be included in curricula of research methods classes so that 

students understand the potential pitfalls of closed science and learn reproducible, transparent 

workflows from the outset (Frank & Saxe, 2012; Hawkins* et al., 2018).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Educating students 

about open science also helps to create a pipeline of researchers who are passionate about 

collaborative, open research, and helping to change norms (Tackett et al., 2019).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Second, beyond 

the classroom, researchers need access to educational resources that help them to understand and 

easily deploy open sciences practices.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: Professional societies must play a role by offering pre-\n\nconferences, webinars, and workshops to facilitate adoption of open science practices.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Funders 

should incorporate budget lines for open sharing practices (e.g., open access to publications that 

arise from a grant; funds to prepare data so they are easily findable and usable by others).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Furthermore, organizations and consortia such as ManyBabies and the PLAY project can take 

responsibility for educating participants about the values and reasons for adopting open science 

As social scientists know, behavior change is difficult, especially when researchers may 

perceive costs or risks in adopting new practices \xe2\x80\x93 as is precisely the situation for open science 

reforms.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: In the face of adoption challenges, one of the most effective tools for behavior change is \n\nthrough a change in social norms (Sunstein, 2019).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
If researchers perceive that the norm in their 

field is to post preprints, share data and materials, and to preregister the details of their studies, 

they will be more likely to adopt such practices, even if they are costly.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: To change norms \xe2\x80\x93 and to \n\npractices.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Changing norms 

 

 

25 

\x0cchange researchers\xe2\x80\x99 perceptions of norms \xe2\x80\x93 the open science movement needs to make visible the 

rapid adoption of open science practices over the past ten years.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Such visibility can be especially 

powerful when social referents, scientists, and organizations with high status within their 

community advocate the practices (Prentice & Paluck, 2020).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Thus, individual scientists \xe2\x80\x93 

especially more prominent or senior ones \xe2\x80\x93 have the responsibility to adopt open science practices 

and endorse and advocate for those practices.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Even an act as simple as highlighting policy 

compliance during peer review (\xe2\x80\x9cI commended the authors for sharing their code and data to 

allow me to reproduce their results\xe2\x80\x9d) can signal shifting norms.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Indeed, communicating values 

and norms around open science through modeling, direct encouragement, and explanations about 

the value of full transparency may be more powerful than signaling style strategies such as 

awarding badges to researchers who engage in open science.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
While 4 of the 20 journals that we 

reviewed give badges, this practice has engendered some mixed feelings in the community and 

has received limited support as an intervention (Rowhani-Farid et al., 2020).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Creating incentives 

Crediting open science practices through informal and formal mechanisms can go a long 

way in incentivizing researchers to engage in such practices.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Informally, individual lab policies 

can endorse open science practices, and encourage and train students to pre-register and openly 

share their research questions, hypotheses, protocols, behavioral coding, videos, raw data, analytic 

code, and so on in existing repositories.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Course assignments that encourage students to access and 

use openly available data can highlight the value of open science by making them beneficiaries of 

the research investments made by others, and to one day pay it forward themselves.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Such 

grassroots efforts will go a long way in producing the next generation of advocates for open 

science practices in developmental research.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
26 

\x0cFormal incentives for open science practices can be instituted through a variety of 

mechanisms, including creation of DOIs associated with shared stimuli, procedures, and data to 

be cited by researchers who access shared resources; consideration of open science practices in 

personnel and tenure reviews of faculty hires and promotions; required sections of grant 

applications stating how and when research products will be shared; and funding streams for the 

preparation of data for open sharing and the reuse of existing datasets to maximize investments.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Building capacity 

One of the most common responses to policy shifts around data sharing is grumbling 

around \xe2\x80\x9cunfunded mandates.\xe2\x80\x9d To recognize the importance of open science, institutions and 

funders must be willing to direct resources towards building and sustaining these practices.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
For 

example, the new NIH data sharing policy explicitly lists data sharing costs as allowable budget 

items; other funders would do well to make this norm explicit.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
The creation and maintenance of 

data sharing resources like Talkbank, Databrary, and Wordbank is also extremely resource 

intensive; although all three were created with US federal funding, few programs exist for funding 

the continued maintenance of such resources.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Finally, global collaboration requires mechanisms for creating capacity across institutions, 

especially outside the United States.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
As an example, the first ManyBabies study received a 

$50,000 grant from the Association for Psychological Science, which was regranted to 

participating labs around the world in small amounts from $500 - $2,500.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Under most funding 

models, such small grants are impossible \xe2\x80\x93 for example, creating US federal subcontracts for 

these amounts would require dozens of hours of paperwork and paying overhead to two 

institutions \xe2\x80\x93 yet they create a substantial incentive to participate in an open, global network.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
27 

\x0c     Conclusion 

A narrow conception of open science can lead to a perceived mismatch between overly 

specific policies and the breadth of research that falls under the umbrella of developmental 

science.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: This conception is mistaken.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
We argue for a broad view of open science that revolves 

around four goals: increasing replicability, ensuring reproducibility, facilitating reuse, and 

broadening global reach.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: Despite impressive progress towards each of these goals in the last ten \n\nyears, challenges remain.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
Nonetheless, there is reason to be optimistic: new practices like 

preprinting are expanding access to the scientific literature; new policy guidelines by funders, 

journals, and so on are ensuring greater levels of data sharing; and new consortia and repositories 

are leading the way towards a representative and robust research.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
These exciting new 

developments illustrate the ways that open and transparent science practices can be adapted to the 

rich variety of perspectives, methods, samples, and goals of developmental science.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence:
28 

\x0cReferences 

Adolph, K. E. (2020).
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: Oh, Behave!
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

sentence: PRESIDENTIAL ADDRESS, XXth International Conference \n\non Infant Studies New Orleans, LA, US May 2016.
source: Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf
Gennetian et al. - 2022 - Open Science in developmental science.pdf

Article

Advances in Developing Human
Resources
2020, Vol.

22(1) 72 \xe2\x80\x9386
\xc2\xa9 The Author(s) 2020
